fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: which one? <table role=presentation>?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:57): the change from "Tables must not be used as layout aids" to "Tables should not be used as layout aids"
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:58): i've never really understood that--it doesn't make sense to me for specs to say what I can use something for, only what the feature does

171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (20:59): Sure it does.  If a feature can be fundamentally misused by an author unaware of the issues that make the misuse bad, the most useful path is to just disallow that use.

171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:01): It's like disallowing people from putting important information in the content of a ::before element, except I think that CSS doesn't explicitly say MUST NOT (because we're somewhat allergic to using the word "must").
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:01): but what does it even mean, if it's not even objectively testable?

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:02): it's fine to say "if you do this, some UAs may do something you don't expect and leave you with something you didn't want", but that should be implied from the requirements placed on the UA
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:02): Authors dont' read UA requirements.  ^_^
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:03): that's sort of the point, it's going to work, so people are going to do it
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:04): eg. it's not something that a validator can flag for people
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:04): Not an automatic validator, no.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, if this encourages authors to put role=presentational on their presentational tables, I think it will be an excellent change.
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:04): That doesn't mean it can't be flagged manually, though.

171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:05): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: If this encourages authors to write more pages with presentational tables rather than using current and upcoming CSS layout techniques, it will be a horrible change.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:05): Also true.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:05): Hard to say which is going to be the bigger effect in practice.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:05): hasn't read the decision yet, though

171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (21:09): One outcome only affects legacy pages (which aren't, in general, very likely to change), while the other affects pages that have not yet been created.  We usually optimize for the latter, precisely because the former are unlikely to change en masse.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): I've seen a lot of templates on Wikipedia that use presentational tables.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): It'd be a bloody lot easier to add role=presentational than to rewrite them to not use tables.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): Particularly if they're protected, so only admins can edit them.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:11): More generally, if some site uses presentational tables, you're a lot more likely to get it fixed to use role=presentational than to get it fixed to not use tables.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:11): How about we say nested tables aren't conforming unless they all have role=presentational?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:11): Or all but the innermost, say.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:12): That would be a nice and concrete improvement, right?  You could also just say they're not conforming period, but that would get fewer sites to change.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:14): (does saying role=presentational on a table even work, per ARIA? don't you have to set it on all the cells and rows and everything?)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:14): If it doesn't, wouldn't that be new information?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:15): one would assume the chairs actually checked that kind of thing before making this kind of decision
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:15): so presumably not
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:15): They only read what's submitted to them, right?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:16): if they only read what's sumitted, then them making decisions on the spec is irresponsible
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:16): I think you're a couple years late in that judgment.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:16): but i doubt that they limit themselves
